title: Proso Millets Pongal | Varigala pongali 😋 | Healthy Meal
content:
Breakfast/ Lunch Recipe: Millets Pongal  Servings: 3 Duration: 30 minutes  I have viewed for healthy recipes and in search of all I found millets is the best substitute for rice 🍚 and I knew you have been come across regarding millets and it is the most trending grain in south India ☺️ and elsewhere . Not only millets, there are other alternatives such as Ragi, Jowar, Bajra and Chickpea flour also helpful for a perfect healthy life. Rice is good to intake in less quantity and I love rice so much because it’s our staple food and habitat to eat in our daily lives so I can find enormous food options in India 🇮🇳 they’re healthy, tasty and delicious too. I believe that if we intake food with in certain range everything goes fine and happy 😃 otherwise it leads to unhealthy 😐 If you’re following my recipes often I have shared few recipes which are prepared with millets, quinoa, oats, Ragi and soon I will share such more beautiful recipes in future. I hope today’s post is gonna help you and do try this Millets Pongal and stay healthy 🙂 Let’s start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients: 1 cup = 160 grams 
  • Proso millets - 1/2 cup
  • Yellow Moong Dal (dry roasted) - 1/2 cup
  • Water - 4 cups
  • Salt - 1 teaspoon
For tempering:
  • Ghee / clarified butter - 1 Tb sp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 teaspoon
  • Cashew nuts - 15 pieces
  • Cumin powder - 1 teaspoon
  • Black Pepper Powder - 1/2 teaspoon
  • Hing / Asafoetida - 1/4 teaspoon
  • Curry leaves - 15 - chopped
 Procedure:
  • Add in millets, Moong Dal and water in pressure cooker on medium heat
  • Cook for 2 whistles and then turn off heat
  • When the pressure releases, open lid and gently mix and keep aside
  • On another pan, add in ghee, cumin seeds and cashew nuts. Sauté them 30 secs on medium heat
  • After that, add black pepper powder, cumin powder, Hing, curry leaves. Sauté more 1 minute and make sure don’t burn the cashew nuts, fry till golden brown or roasted well
  • Turn off heat and then transfer it into cooked millets and dal mixture. Add salt and combine well, serve hot to enjoy the taste of millets Pongal 😍 with Coconut 🌴 Chutney (👈 click for chutney recipe)
  • Happy Cooking and Have a blissful day 💗
